name: downheartedly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in way that shows that you are unhappy and without hope, especially because of a disappointment or failure: "Oh well, at least I tried," he said downheartedly. She listened downheartedly as I explained what we would have to do next. Related word
downheartedSynonyms
dejectedly
despondently
dolefully
gloomily
More examplesFewer examples"It's not my fault it's all gone wrong," he replied downheartedly.They rode away from the city downheartedly, unable to see even a ray of hope.Downheartedly, he went back out into the night to look for the dog."I can't go on any further," she said downheartedly.He downheartedly fell to his knees and began to cry.
